required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Investigation Into the RAtio of LDL-CHolestEroL to HDL-Cholesterol Improvement After Statin Treatment in Korean Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Investigation Into the RAtio of LDL-CHolestEroL to HDL-Cholesterol Improvement After Statin Treatment in Korean Patients

brief_summary.textblock: An observational, non-interventional, multi-centre study to provide further information on the ratio of LDL-C to HDL-C improvement after statin treatment in Korean patients group.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate current LDL/HDL ratio in Korean patients (between baseline & after treatment)
primary_outcome.time_frame: After Treatment : at least 4 weeks before statin taking /Baseline : no limitation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate difference of LDL/HDL ratio among different statins & dosages (between baseline & after treatment)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After Treatment : at least 4 weeks before statin taking / Baseline : no limitation.

arm_group.description: Who have at least made 1 visit to the outpatient clinic within previous 6 months .

study_pop.textblock: Who have at least made 1 visit to the outpatient clinic within previous 6 months .

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who are taking lipid-lowering medication after diagnosed as dyslipidaemia
- Subjects who have at least made 1 visit to the outpatient clinic within previous 6 months
- Subjects who have records of both LDL-C and HDL-C before & after statin treatment (at least four weeks after statin taking)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who are unwilling or unable to provide their examination and lab result of medical chart.

responsible_party.name_title: Hyunah Caroline, Choi / CV TA Physician

clinical_study.keyword: Ratio of Low Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol to High Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol Improvement
